column1: I want to wish you and yours a happy thoughtful and safe Thanksgiving. Many celebrations and traditions look different this year because of COVID-19 and I want to thank you for the sacrifices you've made to help stop the spread.  We will get through this together. https://t.co/IW0ViQGLyq

This year's @UN International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women recognizes that gender-based violence remains a reality for too many worsened by the COVID-19 pandemic. We must continue our work toward equal rights and respect for all.

Without adequate economic relief San Diegans will continue to face an uphill battle during the COVID-19 pandemic. It's crucial Washington brokers a deal to support thousands of American families for the remainder of the crisis.  I spoke with @nbcsandiego about COVID stimulus: https://t.co/VGMcSWPVV2
Get tested and continue wearing your masks practicing social distancing and washing your hands frequently. #COVID19 https://t.co/QRgO4eiRNS

I applaud @UCSanDiego's efforts to employ innovative & modern solutions to fight #COVID19. Contact tracing via bluetooth and other secure tech. may be more efficient than traditional contact tracing.   Read more about the university’s virus tracing app: ⬇️ https://t.co/55S52kdvq0

#ICYMI: New restrictions in San Diego County take effect this Saturday. The best and easiest things we can do to help our local business are wear a mask practice social distance avoid large gatherings. https://t.co/GKJeC3s0x1

While this good news means we're inching closer to an effective & safe COVID vaccine it'll be several months before it's ready and widely available.  We must remain vigilant & continue practicing public health guidance as we head into the new year.  https://t.co/TYY0sxgFXX

Due to San Diego County’s updated #COVID19 case rate we will know next week if many businesses will be forced to suspend indoor operations.   🚨 Wear your mask practice social distance and wash your hands to keep this from happening. 🚨 https://t.co/gbh1kCnLQy

There were over 100000 Americans who tested positive for COVID-19 yesterday. This pandemic is far from over & it's more important than ever we continue to follow public health guidance. Create habits that will stop the spread and protect you your loved ones and your community. https://t.co/zakfmpwbYn

I'm honored and humbled to serve the people of San Diego Poway and Coronado in the U.S. House of Representatives for the next two years.   The gravity of this job is never lost on me and I will keep working hard for everyone regardless of political party or ideology.

My #HealthSTATISTICS Act would enforce the exchange of information between federal & state agencies so patterns can be found & relief can be rapidly deployed.  With 9 million COVID-19 cases nationwide & counting this bill has never been more necessary: https://t.co/vC2jHBb3Ub

As #COVID19 cases surge it's crucial decision-makers health experts & the American people have the information needed to gauge the scope of outbreaks & effectively allocate support. This includes hospitalization & mortality data which the government tracks but decides to hide. https://t.co/OmfBMDxjqw
Si uno de sus familiares o seres queridos murió debido a COVID-19 puedes someter su nombre y una fotografía para honrar a esa persona en un altar de muertos dedicado a las víctimas de COVID.

We've seen how COVID-19 disproportionately affects Latinos. In CA Latinos make up nearly half of COVID deaths.   To honor the nearly 900 San Diegans lost to coronavirus local leaders will place a special “altar de muertos” near the east entrance of the County Admin. Center.

This pandemic is not over. We know what we need to do to stop the spread of COVID-19 especially as we head into flu season. Do the right thing to protect yourselves your families workers and businesses who need to stay open to survive. https://t.co/nprvREtxHl

Suggesting we have “turned the corner” on coronavirus in the U.S. is dangerous and misleading. In fact COVID-19 cases are rising and the virus is now making its way into more and more rural communities across the country. https://t.co/6jebGwUdnI

As experts predict a third surge of coronavirus cases this year it's crucial we fix our public health data infrastructure which would better support efforts to combat COVID-19 & improve our system for years to come.  https://t.co/55fKafYrpx

COVID-19 has posed an unimaginable challenge to the mental health of our youth. This piece details the struggles adolescents face in the wake of this pandemic and how students like San Diego junior Aashi Mittal are working to help their peers.  https://t.co/2A4Je0NKBZ

Trillions of dollars of federal spending have been authorized and disbursed in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic & economic crisis. You can track this money and explore the data thanks to the nonpartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget's interactive digital tools. ⬇️ https://t.co/7m1baDnvOz

San Diego-based innovation continues playing a vital role in the fight against the coronavirus. At least 60 biotech companies in SD County are currently developing #COVID19 treatments vaccines or tests. Academic & research institutions also contribute to this valuable effort.

According to @CDCgov flu vaccinations can help reduce the overall impact of respiratory illnesses on the population & lessen the burden on the healthcare system during this upcoming flu season.  For more information on flu vaccines and COVID-19 visit: https://t.co/qAyRDAKwUH

Great convo with @BiocomCA & SD experts about nation-wide issues: COVID therapies & vaccines need for public health stockpiles & my #EndingtheDiagnosticOdysseyAct to expand access to next-gen diagnostics. It's imperative we lower drug costs without sacrificing innovation. https://t.co/lUpc34RHQ2

It's that time of year: this week we are hosting an info night for students interested in attending the U.S. Service Academies. While previously held in person we've moved the event online due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  Join us! RSVP via the link below: https://t.co/RExnSKM26u https://t.co/QBJIrCEJrH

👩‍🏫👨‍🏫This #WorldTeachersDay we honor our teachers in San Diego Poway and Coronado for all their work to help our students learn and grow. They've stepped up during this pandemic in exceptional ways. We thank them for their service in educating and preparing future generations.

I'm heartened to hear President Trump is feeling better & continue to hope he recovers soon. That said I'm troubled & angered by the rhetoric he's promoted today. To suggest we shouldn’t be ‘afraid’ dishonors every American who's lost someone to COVID-19. https://t.co/z4AceXhkhK
🚨 Important COVID-19 updates for San Diego County on testing sites for school personnel and reopening of parks 🚨  Click here for more information: https://t.co/BaaE1iJjsT

Thank you to @DataCoalition @GovMattersTV for inviting me to speak about my Health STATISTICS Act during yesterday's first session of the GovDATAx 2020 program.   We need to pass this bill to fix inconsistencies in data collection & essential reporting to fight COVID-19. https://t.co/vMyXpIhOOL

As we kick off #NationalSmallBusinessWeek I want to recognize the hardworking entrepreneurs in San Diego Poway and Coronado. We must continue to support them during this crisis and I’m committed to back policies that help the small businesses  in our communities recover. https://t.co/CZtHCw4sNf

FYI for San Diegans facing economic hardship due to COVID-19: @SanDiegoCounty will be accepting applications for an emergency rental assistance program beginning Sept. 24 thru Oct. 8.   For eligibility requirements and more information check the link:  https://t.co/haesxYeRm6

‼️Only 10 days left to complete the 2020 US Census‼️  Every household in Poway San Diego & Coronado that responds helps ensure our communities receive the full representation & funding they deserve for the next decade.   Fill out your census now: https://t.co/rR6ucozvzJ

Asian Americans have faced increased acts of bigotry and violence fuelled by the reckless remarks of President Trump and others. Yesterday the House passed a resolution condemning the anti-Asian rhetoric and hate related to COVID-19.  https://t.co/XMWHfKWq1U

Congress can't afford to approach this situation with an all-or-nothing mindset. The only way a new COVID package gets done is by coming together for a compromise that works for everyone. We need to put partisanship aside and form an agreement for the sake of the American people.

Americans need relief now. It's particularly cruel and economically unwise to let COVID relief programs zero out while the government fights over political folly.  That's why I joined my @ProbSolveCaucus colleagues in a bipartisan effort that offers a fair solution: https://t.co/8wv3f1IIg8

Today marks the beginning of Hispanic Heritage month. This month we honor Latino and Hispanic Americans’ contributions to our nation. Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic Latinos are proving themselves more essential than ever and resilient in the face of adversity. #HHM2020 https://t.co/CfN3NIiplh
Food insecurity was a major problem even before COVID-19. The devastating effects of the pandemic exacerbate this struggle for millions of American families and children facing hunger.

He said he didn’t want to create panic so he publicly played down COVID-19's risk. That's the definition of gaslighting.  With 190000 dead–the lives of our loved ones friends neighbors fellow citizens forever lost–this is not how real leaders respond to public health crises.

It was clear from the start that the president wasn't serious about protecting American lives from COVID-19 despite knowing that a "deadly" catastrophe was set to rip through our country.  Now we have the audio to confirm it: https://t.co/Nm8JisXNSL

Thank you @RepSusanDavis for leading today’s day of action. The Heroes Act which was passed in May is an inclusive response to the COVID-19 crisis. We urge the Senate for a vote on this bill to protect our children families & staff for a safe return to school. #SaveOurSchools https://t.co/Uq9qxr020N

Join us as we discuss the start of the new academic year in the time of COVID-19. We must adequately fund our schools so that children can continue to learn and schools can reopen safely.  https://t.co/6EFU6c94EK

#OTD in 1964 LBJ signed the Food Stamp Act to ensure all families have the resources they need to keep food on the table. COVID-19 has brought about unprecedented challenges and we must reinforce access to #SNAP so that no one goes hungry.  https://t.co/ZQwhfgjR2b
Entrance fees to all national parks are waived today but COVID-19 has affected operations in some places. Check conditions here: https://t.co/IWB74iqg8p #RecreateResponsibly

Today I voted to pass the Delivering for America Act to provide additional funds to the U.S. Postal Service & prohibit changes to operations/service levels that would impede prompt & reliable service for the duration of the COVID crisis or through Jan. 2021.📫#DontMessWithUSPS

However some families have found at least a little relief utilizing provisions within the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act Congress passed back in March. It lets parents take 12 weeks of paid family leave to help children with distanced schooling. https://t.co/SBIQd6t5fH
The COVID crisis has changed the landscape of our daily lives. Many working parents now face endless hours of child supervision and assisted virtual learning as K-12 classes move online this fall.

Healthcare professionals researchers and policymakers across the country have been 'in the dark' due to a lack of cohesive and consolidated data on the coronavirus. Our bill would change that.  https://t.co/lG3PAPKXkH

THREAD: Today I introduced the bipartisan Health STATISTICS Act with @RepLucyMcBath @RepAnnaEshoo and @RepBrianFitz to improve data sharing and collection efforts crucial to combatting the COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/vC2jHBb3Ub

The COVID-19 health crisis has affected individuals of all ages. This Thursday leaders from three major nonprofits focused on aging will share how they’re supporting seniors during this pandemic. Sign up for this virtual event here: https://t.co/cQ7S34G3Ds

Hoy los censistas comienzan a visitar hogares que aún no responden al censo. Estos trabajadores tomarán medidas para proteger contra COVID-19.   ➡️Recuerde que los censistas no pedirán información sobre su estado migratorio ni seguro social. #HazteContar https://t.co/30YcqFXKOv

Door-to-door knocking for the Census begins today! Census workers will follow safe practices by maintaining social distance and wearing masks and will never ask for personal info including citizenship status or social security details. #2020Census  https://t.co/DydoJyEst9
I've joined my fellow members of Congress to urge the continued support for the @USPS in any final COVID-19 relief legislation. Read more here: https://t.co/pxJ7Oq9N1e

Prices were expected to spike as much as 40% with the surge of care needed to treat COVID patients. But with non-urgent appointments and procedures delayed or canceled claims will decrease and keep insurance affordable for the 1.5 million who rely on @CoveredCA for coverage.

🚨DEADLINE ALERT🚨  This Friday August 7 is the deadline for applications for @CityofSanDiego's COVID-19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program. San Diegans with low income who can’t pay rent due to the pandemic can apply for the program by visiting https://t.co/pxSystOQEA.

We should use every tool available to combat the spread of COVID-19. Bluetooth technology can keep personal data safe and offers a system significantly more efficient effective and even private than traditional contact tracing.  https://t.co/X26HrZALJN

Federal relief funds continue pouring into our region as a result of COVID-19. San Diego recently received $1782000 as part of the Economic Development Fund’s CARES Act Recovery Assistance investment. https://t.co/Qf6H7uRlnr

In fact a paper by @ljiresearch scientists was given a shout out by Dr. Anthony Fauci during a congressional hearing this morning: "This is work we really need to pursue. We’re just at the cusp of really understanding the importance of this type of response in COVID-19.” https://t.co/8A1zoNNrwa https://t.co/beji7vXUdc

These are only a few of the life science companies and institutes in our region. This sector is as important as ever as it focuses on treatments and cures to COVID-19 and other life-threatening illnesses.

I visited @Hologic on the day they were approved for their new COVID-19 test kits in March. Their platform machine is used in many hospitals and labs throughout the country and their test kit is much faster than others taking only hours instead of days to deliver results. https://t.co/Zi3nkJjezI

.@ljiresearch is at the center of a global collaboration to understand & advance antibody treatments against COVID-19. Led by @EOSaphire they've been tracking mutations to help develop vaccines & therapies. She joined us for a virtual town hall in March: https://t.co/goB8Opdqi2

Since the start of the #COVID19 crisis biotech companies and research institutes in SD have been working nonstop to help.   I met with @InovioPharma's Dr. Kim at their San Diego lab in Oct. 2016. When cases came to the US INOVIO was one of the first to develop a trial vaccine. https://t.co/0pjSunDPRP

.@RepDavids and I joined @ppi this week to record a podcast conversation about rebuilding America's fiscal strength during & post-COVID. We touched on budget priorities the value of automatic stabilizers to keep relief rolling and how we can return with a resilient recovery. https://t.co/YBD4ub8PNg

That is why I cosponsored @RepDennyHeck's bill to provide $100 billion in rental assistance. It is critical we provide support for the thousands of renters across the country who are financially strapped due to the COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/Ef1sCNaUQD

COVID-19 has put unprecedented stress on nurses doctors & other medical professionals. This has not compromised the quality care at @UCSDHealth which now ranks as one of the top hospitals in CA & 🇺🇸. San Diego is fortunate to have the dedicated healthcare professionals at UCSD. https://t.co/tFtFrIX90u

I joined @RepBradWenstrup to introduce bipartisan legislation to boost public awareness of the life-saving contribution of plasma donations in the fight against #COVID19. We thank @SenAmyKlobuchar & @SenatorWicker for leading this effort in the Senate.   https://t.co/G2Mfmu1xAl

Si usted ha enfrentado problemas económicos debido a #COVID19 puede solicitar apoyo para pagar su renta por medio del programa de asistencia de alquiler de emergencia: https://t.co/ka7X2eCvic  La fecha límite para solicitar por internet es el 7 de agosto 2020. https://t.co/UA5tJ7DKut

If #COVID19 has affected your ability to pay the rent you can apply for the @CityofSanDiego emergency rental assistance program here: https://t.co/pxSystOQEA  Applications will be accepted online through August 7 2020. https://t.co/msjch4YPL0

I’m saddened to hear about the passing of Dr. Flossie Wong-Staal. As a molecular biologist her groundbreaking H.I.V. research is now a solid foundation for COVID-19 research. We're lucky to have had her live in San Diego & work at @UCSanDiego during the last years of her life.

This edition of #PetersinPlace comes from @CABRILLONPS to honor July as National Parks and Recreation month. San Diego is the ideal place for outdoor enthusiasts but we must remain responsible during the #COVID19 pandemic even if outdoor activities present a low-moderate risk. https://t.co/2mYJOIM677

➡️The USA Telecommunications Act would support innovators in developing and deploying advanced technologies like 5G. COVID-19 has exposed our dire need for an updated telecommunications infrastructure - one that can ensure reliable telework and online learning for every American.

In May the House passed the #HeroesAct to extended #COVID programs critical to saving the lives & livelihoods of families and businesses hit by the pandemic. Over the next few weeks we expect a stimulus package will be approved by the Senate so aid can get to those who need it.

Too many refused to follow public health guidelines which is the ONLY way to avoid and reverse closings.    Show our businesses and workers how much you care: wear a mask wash your hands and social distance. It’s all we can do until we have a vaccine.
THREAD: Due to recent COVID-19 spikes in California and a rapid increase in cases within our specific region Gov. @GavinNewsom announced today that indoor operations must close effective immediately.

Our students & schools face many challenges due to #COVID19 but changes to the international students’ visa rules don’t solve these problems. Recent restrictions involving U.S. travelers already in place pose additional barriers for students if they are forced to leave.
Yesterday I met up with @RepSusanDavis @RepJuanVargas and @RepMikeLevin (socially distanced!) to talk about San Diego jobs police reform COVID response and more. https://t.co/8wqNEwkBQb

Support takes on different forms during these challenging times. If you have recovered from #COVID19 please consider donating your plasma to @sdbloodbank to help save lives. Click here to be qualified for a donation:  https://t.co/KQW7LB91B9. https://t.co/AE6tFNAFLo

San Diego expects warm temps. this holiday weekend but that doesn’t mean we'll celebrate like we usually do. If you leave your home make sure to keep a safe distance from others while wearing face coverings. It's necessary to follow ALL recommendations to overcome #COVID19. https://t.co/YwEwPNMGz4

Today is the last day to apply for Paycheck Protection Program (#PPP) funding for small businesses experiencing hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This funding was made available through the CARES Act.  To apply visit: https://t.co/VVTjCJsm6k

While scientists in San Diego & around the world battle #COVID19 we must continue wearing face masks practicing social distancing avoiding large gatherings and washing our hands. The virus has not gone away but our actions can dramatically limit the spread. https://t.co/erbrvlii6O

#FYI: @CoveredCA announced that Californians have more time to sign up for health care coverage during the #COVID19 pandemic extending the current special enrollment deadline through the end of July.  If you haven't already secure your coverage now: https://t.co/WwE6ZbqksJ

I joined my @EnergyCommerce colleagues to hear from Dr. Fauci and members of the White House Coronavirus Task Force about the admin.'s response to the #COVID19 crisis. A takeaway: they all directly contradicted the president's call to slow testing.  https://t.co/Dt0eCM7zRc

Face coverings slow the spread of COVID-19. Please continue to protect yourself and others by wearing a mask when you leave the house.😷  Until there's a vaccine masks social distancing and handwashing are all we've got to stay healthy and keep businesses open.  📽️: @NIST https://t.co/lJhKKBe4vX

Earlier today @SBAgov announced a re-opening of the Economic Injury Disaster Loan (#EIDL) portal for small businesses struggling from the economic impacts of COVID-19. Visit the Disaster Loan Application page for more information: https://t.co/oggxUEfdEP

Los dueños de negocios también han trabajado duro para establecer normas e impedir otro brote de COVID-19 que podría llevar a una nueva cuarentena. Siga las reglas para cuidarse y apoyar estos esfuerzos.

Esta semana se espera la reapertura de los muelles estacionamientos en las playas bares gimnasios y museos entre otros lugares. Aunque estos cambios agraden a varios Sandieguinos expertos médicos se preparan ante la posibilidad de otra ola de #COVID19.

By the end of this week San Diego’s boardwalks beach parking lots bars gyms and museums among other places will reopen. Although these changes are a sigh of relief for many our local health community is bracing for a significant #COVID19 resurgence. https://t.co/OtG3s9htP7

The 57th anniversary of the #EqualPayAct reminds us that the gender pay gap in America still exists worsened by #COVID19 & disproportionately affects women of color. The House passed #HR7 to ensure equal pay for equal work; the Senate should do the same. https://t.co/vuDKlxhjfk

#ICYMI - on Friday the president signed the #PPP Flexibility Act which will expand the benefits and flexibility of emergency #COVID19 loans for small businesses across the country.  Find out more about the changes: https://t.co/GnXQxM6h5C

This morning I'll join my @EnergyCommerce colleagues to hear from @GovWhitmer @GovofCO and @AsaHutchinson about their state-level responses to the #COVID19 pandemic. Tune in at 11:30am EST/8:30am PST: https://t.co/wCFQys6hC6

Today @RepArrington and I led 58 of our colleagues in a bipartisan letter to House leadership calling on Congress to tackle our nation's federal debt once the COVID crisis comes to an end.  Read more: https://t.co/FYuO5ubM3z

May we pause today to remember the over 100000 lives lost in this country due to COVID-19. Each one was a parent grandparent sibling child a valued community member. We must work to prevent more lives from being lost. #DayOfMourning

As we conclude Asian Pacific American Heritage Month I am honored to celebrate San Diego's AAPI community and their many contributions to our region. We must continue to protect and expand the American dream for AAPIs and all Americans especially during #COVID19. https://t.co/q9po9VXg1c

San Diego cuenta con recursos durante el cierre de escuelas debido a #COVID19. Familias con estudiantes que recibían comidas gratis o a precio reducido califican para recibir hasta $365 por niño para comprar alimentos. Solicite P-EBT antes del 30 de junio: https://t.co/hSU6kADNH1

San Diegans facing food insecurity during school closures due to #COVID19 are not alone. Families with students who received free or reduced-price meals are eligible to receive up to $365 per child for groceries. Apply before June 30 for P-EBT benefits⬇️ https://t.co/cPFszm86V4

Widespread testing and contact tracing are the only way we can stay on top of this virus. If you have a symptom of #COVID19 get tested - it’s free.   Find the nearest testing site near you: https://t.co/RBxEkYWhRI

Know an older San Diegan looking to access food safely during #COVID19? A new local initiative called the 'Great Plates Delivered' program will deliver 3 free and healthy meals a day to homes of older adults who qualify. https://t.co/5M6mnGuROZ

We've voted on 4 pieces of emergency legislation since Feb. to properly respond to #COVID19 and we know there’s much more work to do. #AutomaticStabilizers would expedite this process and not hold up desperately needed aid while negotiations take place. https://t.co/hyC8vDI8yT

Even @federalreserve Chair Jerome Powell testified Wednesday it was going to take big action by Congress to address the economic damage done by the #coronavirus. #AutomaticStabilizers is a big proactive solution offering immediate and long-term relief. https://t.co/Lyx2OsiyBO
Economists agree: the best way to combat the financial crisis facing our country is to build #AutomaticStabilizers into #COVID19 response legislation.  https://t.co/DmlanPyB6F

We've said it more than once and we'll say it again: #AutomaticStabilizers are critical to adequately strengthen the health of the American economy and support the livelihood of the American people during #COVID19. https://t.co/nBs9vjXGIs

Watch the skies San Diego! The @usairforce Thunderbirds will be flying over our communities tomorrow in recognition of our frontline heroes and their endless effort to provide care during #COVID19. #StayHome and join in. https://t.co/RWOQTSUYgp

#ICYMI: This timely piece explains why automatic triggers are so critical for the success of federal #COVID relief... and is exactly why we urged for the inclusion of automatic stabilizers in our letter to the Speaker this morning: https://t.co/NyMJkqNXKN https://t.co/lYOZuSsv6f

The #coronavirus pandemic has uprooted the lives of many Americans and our country will feel the impacts of the damage for years to come. Nearly all economists agree: Congress needs to go big to save our economy. (6/7)

THREAD: This morning I led six of my colleagues in a letter to the Speaker emphasizing automatic stabilizers as an essential inclusion to the next #COVID19 response package. (1/7) https://t.co/sE0dcQU40o

This #RepPetersInPlace episode touches on why we must bolster mental health resources and suicide prevention assistance during #COVID19. It's imperative we ensure our hospitals and schools are adequately prepared to support higher numbers of struggling patients & students. ⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/FU6QDfzClF

As we face the national public health crisis of #COVID19 the administration continues to roll back dozens of EPA regulations put in place to protect the American people. The dismantling of these standards hurts the planet and endangers us all.   https://t.co/jC26MV8iFS

Looking forward to joining @mikeallen and @axios for a riveting conversation this morning unpacking the effect #COVID19 will have on life-saving trials and treatments — like gene therapy — and biomedical innovation. Tune in at 9:30 AM PST: https://t.co/mGegfofuFR
I'll be joining @Axios' @mikeallen on Monday for a discussion about the importance of biotechnology in the context of #COVID19 and beyond. Don't miss it - join us! https://t.co/f5FWnS1S4B

On Monday I sat down with @KPBSMidday to discuss the latest Coronavirus Relief Package. Tune in: https://t.co/wjdyDIJ1GG https://t.co/deqtjVJJHG

We’re seeing the dedication and bravery our servicemembers are known best for as they enhance efforts to combat #COVID19 domestically & uphold duties abroad. Their commitment will be carried on by the future military leaders attending U.S. service academies as the class of 2024. https://t.co/zimdeGLC9G

As the season grows warmer and provisions of the stay at home order slowly begin to lift continue to be smart and stay safe. Many who visited our reopened beaches this weekend did a decent job keeping with #COVID19 best practices. Please stick with it. https://t.co/pc0Kw2oHwz

On #WorkersMemorialDay let's take a moment to remember the hard-working American men and women who have been lost to this tragic virus. We must continue to commit ourselves towards securing greater worker protections for those on the front lines of #COVID19. https://t.co/JXzRcOGf2E

Due to #COVID19 we've made some changes to this year's Art Competition. The deadline has been extended to May 7 and we're asking participants to email a picture of their submission instead of dropping by our office. Find out more: https://t.co/I6gNN0pg3O https://t.co/wsiCZalPMg

An unpredictable and trying time for most Americans a continued effort is needed to sustain the economy and protect homeowners. I joined my @NewDemCoalition colleagues to call on federal agencies to stabilize the mortgage market during the #COVID19 pandemic: https://t.co/uOPYgOK8YZ

The House just passed the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act to provide $484 billion for resources desperately needed by Americans and health care workers to combat the #COVID19 pandemic.  Find out more here: https://t.co/V2WFZlHS0V

Keep an eye out: tomorrow morning local pilots will be taking to the sky to show support for all the medical professionals who have been working around the clock to provide San Diegans with quality care during the #COVID19 crisis.🌴🛩️🏥🌤️ https://t.co/5plyzOeWxw

As some of our city parks reopen I urge San Diegans to remain vigilant and responsible. Enjoy the weather and fresh air but don't blow it. Take special care in continuing to social distance wear masks and keep up with other public health guidelines.  https://t.co/n0oqjUMqxu

On Friday I introduced the Stop Health Premium Spikes Act with @RepAngieCraig to help mitigate the drastic health care premium increases expected as a result of the surge in medical care costs due to #COVID19. Read more: https://t.co/h2OPzppV3I

🚨DEADLINE ALERT🚨 - Social Security recipients with children under 17 need to claim dependents with the IRS before tomorrow April 22 at 9:00 AM PST if they want to receive the full amount of their #coronavirus rebate.   https://t.co/MVJJh1o5J1

Today I sent two letters—one to @USTreasury @SBAgov and another to House committee leadership—calling for more investment in #COVID19 relief programs like #PPP that prioritize aid for smaller businesses.   Find copies of the letters here: https://t.co/dJqDuvHjhH

For San Diego seniors AARP will be holding a telephone town hall this morning at 10:00 AM to help you identify and avoid fraudulent schemes related to #COVID19. Learn how to protect yourself from scammers cyber-attacks and other deceitful activity. https://t.co/b96jovXRsr

As we work to overcome a respiratory disease pandemic the EPA is rolling back air quality standards that will expose Americans to dangerous mercury and toxic pollution. Removing public health protections during #COVID19 makes no sense. #FollowTheScience  https://t.co/p6E4JyLDox

I spoke with @fox5sandiego's @RaoulMartinezTV this morning about what San Diegans can expect out of Congress' ongoing effort to provide financial relief to families and small businesses during the #COVID19 pandemic.🎙️📺📡  Watch here: https://t.co/CDq8jHJLow

Enacting automatic triggers for #COVID19 assistance programs like #PPP or #directpayments would be a smart efficient fail-safe way to ensure those struggling receive the financial support they need in a timely manner without having to wait for additional congressional action.

Federal programs created to alleviate financial burdens caused by #coronavirus will run out of money before this crisis is over unless Congress passes legislation allocating more funds to keep the aid systems afloat.
